title: Adjust coefficient for confounders — adjusted_coef
text: function calculates adjusted effect controlling confounding effects. can use d values standardized regression coefficients.

title: Adjust coefficient for confounders — adjusted_coef
Adjust coefficient for confounders — adjusted_coef
text: effect_xz Effect x y given z effect_uxz Effect u y given x z effect_d Effect size difference interest

title: Adjust coefficient for confounders — adjusted_coef
text: Adjusted effect size x y given u z

title: APA Format — apa
text: function formats decimals leading zeroes creating reports scientific style.

title: APA Format — apa
APA Format — apa
text: value set numeric values, either single number, vector, set columns. decimals number decimal points desired output. leading Logical value: TRUE leading zeroes decimals FALSE leading zeroes decimals. default TRUE.

title: APA Format — apa
text: function creates "pretty" character vectors numeric variables   printing part report. value can take single number,   matrix, vector, multiple columns data frame, long   numeric. values coerced numeric characters   logical values, process may result error values   truly alphabetical.

title: APA Format — apa

what: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: function displays d two subjects groups gives central non-central confidence interval using pooled standard deviation denominator.

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
code: calculate_d(   m1 = NULL,   m2 = NULL,   sd1 = NULL,   sd2 = NULL,   n1 = NULL,   n2 = NULL,   t = NULL,   model = NULL,   df = NULL,   x_col = NULL,   y_col = NULL,   a = 0.05 )

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: m1 mean group one m2 mean group two sd1 standard deviation group one sd2 standard deviation group two n1 sample size group one n2 sample size group two t optional, calculate d independent t, must include n1 n2 degrees freedom model optional, calculate d t.test independent t, must still include n1 n2 df optional dataframe includes x_col y_col x_col name column contains factor levels numeric vector group 1 scores y_col name column contains dependent score numeric vector group 2 scores significance level

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: Provides effect size (Cohen's *d*) associated central non-central confidence intervals, *t*-statistic, confidence intervals associated means group, well standard deviations standard errors means group. one-tailed confidence interval also included sensitivity analyses. d effect size dlow lower level confidence interval d value dhigh upper level confidence interval d value M1 mean group one sd1 standard deviation group one mean se1 standard error group one mean M1low lower level confidence interval group one mean M1high upper level confidence interval group one mean M2 mean group two sd2 standard deviation group two mean se2 standard error group two mean M2low lower level confidence interval group two mean M2high upper level confidence interval group two mean spooled pooled standard deviation sepooled pooled standard error n1 sample size group one n2 sample size group two df degrees freedom (n1 - 1 + n2 - 1) t t-statistic p p-value estimate d statistic confidence interval APA style markdown printing statistic t-statistic APA style markdown printing

title: \(d_s\) for Between Subjects with Pooled SD Denominator — calculate_d
text: calculate \(d_s\), mean two subtracted mean one divided pooled standard deviation. $$d_s = \frac{M_1 - M_2}{S_{pooled}}$$ provide one combination following: 1: m1 n2 2: t, n1, n2 3: model, n1, n2 4: df, "x_col", "y_col" 5: x_col, y_col numeric vectors

what: Convert d to Cohen's f — d_to_f2
title: Convert d to Cohen's f — d_to_f2
text: function allows convert d Cohen's f f^2 statistics.

title: Convert d to Cohen's f — d_to_f2
Convert d to Cohen's f — d_to_f2
text: d effect size convert

title: Convert d to Cohen's f — d_to_f2
text: Cohen's f f^2 statistics f d values translated f f2 d values translated f^2

what: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
title: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
text: function calculates number needed treat continuous measures (Cohen's d) using Kraemer Kupfer (2006) formula.

title: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
text: d effect size

title: Convert d to Number Needed to Treat — d_to_nnt
text: Kraemer H.C., Kupfer D.J. (2006) Size treatment effects importance clinical research practice. Biolological Psychiatry, 59, 990–996. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.biopsych.2005.09.014

what: Convert d to correlation coefficient — d_to_r
title: Convert d to correlation coefficient — d_to_r
text: function allows convert d Pearson's correlation coefficient

title: Convert d to correlation coefficient — d_to_r
Convert d to correlation coefficient — d_to_r
text: d effect size convert

title: Convert d to correlation coefficient — d_to_r
text: correlation coefficient

title: Visualization for Estimating \(d_s\) — estimate_d
text: function displays visualization effect sizes.

title: Visualization for Estimating \(d_s\) — estimate_d
code: estimate_d(   m1 = NULL,   m2 = NULL,   sd1 = NULL,   sd2 = NULL,   n1 = NULL,   n2 = NULL,   d = NULL )

title: Visualization for Estimating \(d_s\) — estimate_d
text: m1 mean first group m2 mean second group sd1 standard deviation first group sd2 standard deviation second group n1 sample size first group n2 sample size second group d estimate effect size

title: Visualization for Estimating \(d_s\) — estimate_d
text: Returns pretty graph d effect size

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: function calculates probability superiority independent samples Cohen's d calculation.

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
code: probability_superiority(   d = NULL,   m1 = NULL,   m2 = NULL,   sd1 = NULL,   sd2 = NULL,   n1 = NULL,   n2 = NULL,   a = 0.05,   t = NULL,   model = NULL,   df = NULL,   x_col = NULL,   y_col = NULL )

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: d effect size m1 mean group one m2 mean group two sd1 standard deviation group one sd2 standard deviation group two n1 sample size group one n2 sample size group two significance level t optional, calculate d independent t, must include n1 n2 degrees freedom model optional, calculate d t.test independent t, must still include n1 n2 df optional dataframe includes x_col y_col x_col name column contains factor levels numeric vector group 1 scores y_col name column contains dependent score numeric vector group 2 scores

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: probability superiority.

title: Probability of Superiority Calculation — probability_superiority
text: provide one combination following: 1: d 2: m1 n2 3: t, n1, n2 4: model, n1, n2 5: df, "x_col", "y_col" 6: x_col, y_col numeric vectors

what: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
text: function calculates proportion overlap two independent group d effect size calculations. Cohen's u1, u2, u3 proportion overlap provided.

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
code: proportion_overlap(   model = NULL,   x_col = NULL,   y_col = NULL,   df = NULL,   d = NULL )

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
text: model saved independent t-test model x_col name column contains factor levels numeric vector group 1 scores y_col name column contains dependent score numeric vector group 2 scores df optional dataframe includes x_col y_col d previously calculated d value

title: Proportion Overlap Calculations for Cohen's d — proportion_overlap
text: list following: u1 Proportion non-overlap across distributions u2 Proportion one group proportion group u3 Proportion one group smaller median group p_o Proportional overlap distributions
